There is currently no way to modify the page layout based on the media type (specifically, print). This essentially adds modifiers to columns, and provides a helper class to hide when the print type is in use.

N/A

Issues.Title: Setting `$control-padding-vertical` pads SELECTs incorrectly (value becomes invisible)
Issues.Body:
This is a bug about **Bulma**.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.7.2
My **browser** is: Google Chrome Version 71.0.3578.98 (Official Build) (64-bit)
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate** - I've searched.

### Description

Setting `$control-padding-vertical` pads selects incorrectly (value becomes invisible)

### Steps to Reproduce

Set `$control-padding-vertical` to some higher value than the default - like 18px;
See working example at [https://github.com/antony/bulma-padding-issue](https://github.com/antony/bulma-padding-issue)

### Expected behavior

Padding is increased as per `input` or similar controls.

### Actual behavior

Select selected value becomes invisible - off bottom of control
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Setting `$control-padding-vertical` pads SELECTs incorrectly (value becomes invisible)" (#2319)

Issues.Title: Full width non responsive layout
Issues.Body:
This is about the Bulma CSS framework
I'm using Bulma 0.7.2 

We have a requirement for a project where the admin layout must be completely non-responsive. On mobile, the layout must remain at size 1064px with a horizontal scrollbar. This behavior is similar to the auth0.com dashboard. We have a navbar, a sidebar and columns exactly like auth0.com

We need this because the admin dashboard is quite complex and we want the same view on mobile as well as desktop.

Steps to view the required behavior:

Create a free account at https://auth0.com. On the dashboard page, resize the browser window and you will observe that the layout remains fixed and a horizontal scrollbar appears when window width is less than 1064px. 

Another example of what we are trying to achieve: http://www.profoundgrid.com/examples/fixed.html
Resizing the window in this link behaves exactly like what we need.

How can we achieve this with Bulma? Any help is appreciated. Thanks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Full width non responsive layout" (#2305)

Issues.Title: The actual gap (horizontal margins) of the fluid container is not 32px but 64px
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **the Docs**.

### Overview of the problem
<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->
This is about the Bulma **Docs** 

### Description
The docs state that:
> This container is fluid: it will have a **32px gap** on either side, on any viewport size.

But the actual gap is 64px on both sides even in the example where the quoted text [is placed](https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/container/).  

### Expected behavior
The fluid container gaps should be 32px each.

### Actual behavior
The fluid container gaps are 64px each.

--------------
